review.title: Automatic Synthesis of Geometry Problems for an Intelligent Tutoring System
review.abstract: This paper presents an intelligent tutoring system, GeoTutor, for Euclidean Geometry that is automatically able to synthesize proof problems and their respective solutions given a geometric figure together with a set of properties true of it. GeoTutor can provide personalized practice problems that address student deficiencies in the subject matter.

sections.heading: 5 Related Work
sections.text: Existing automated tutoring systems provided by Wolfram Alpha (wol), Coursera (Fast et al. 2013) and AutoTutor (aut) cannot provide students with personalized feedback. None of these systems can automatically synthesize analog exercises to provide a personalized practice to a student who has difficulty in specific areas or types of exercises. sections.heading: 6 Conclusions
sections.text: We have described and evaluated an automatic problem synthesis technique for GeoTutor, an intelligent tutoring system for Euclidean geometry. GeoTutor has the ability to synthesize personalized tasks for students, create analog but distinct exercises to reduce fraud, and give the teacher the ability to automatically generate interesting tasks, exam questions and their solutions. Generating problems for tasks or exams is a difficult and lengthy process for a teacher, and the gift of time for a teacher is the most valuable asset for the education of all children. Time means more individual attention for each student so that teachers can do what they do best: teach students. In the future, we plan to deploy GeoTutor in secondary schools and conduct user studies to understand its effectiveness in an educational environment.
